p: Normally, in screening studies with plant extracts and fractions, only MIC values lower than 100 μg/mL are considered active [ 28]. In general, most plant extracts present weak antimicrobial activity, with MIC values ranging in the mg/mL scale for crude extracts against various pathogens [ 28]. More specifically, in the case of essential oils, MIC values can range from 36,300 μg/mL to 0.001 μg/mL, and most of the activity is found in oxygenated terpenoids, but some hydrocarbons also might also exhibit some antimicrobial effects [ 28].
